text: Absalom while he was alive had made a stone pillar and set it up in the King's Valley as a memorial to himself, for he thought to himself, “I don't have a son18:18. In 14:27 it's recorded that Absalom had three sons, so either they had died or Absalom had disowned them. to keep the memory of my name alive.” He named the pillar after himself, and it's called Absalom's Monument even today.
